whaledividers.defaultWidth.description: Default width used for dividers when not otherwise specified

whaledividers.spaceComments.description: When creating dividers in comments, add space between divider and comment delimiters

whaledividers.spaceTitle.description: When creating dividers with text, add spaces on either side of the text within the divider

whaledividers.alwaysWhale.description: When creating dividers with text that is the same length or longer than the divider width, always include a whale character on each side

whaledividers.shorterTail.markdownDescription: When creating dividers with an uneven number of whale characters (`#whaledividers.whaleCharacter#`) on each side, whether to make the right-hand side (the divider tail) the shorter side

whaledividers.whaleCharacter.markdownDescription: The character used to construct a whale divider (`=` looks most like a whale!)

whaledividers.advanced.controlCharacter.description: The special character used to delimit typed-out divider snippets (this character will not be able to appear in divider titles)

whaledividers.advanced.maxWidth.description: Maximum width for a divider (default is 72 as per PEP8)

markdownEnumDescriptions: Only ASCII characters from codepoints 32 (space ` `) to 126 (tilde `~`)
Most printable Unicode characters (majority emoji support as this includes the zero-width joiner)

Most printable Unicode characters, like above, but also includes the [format character codepage](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unicode_character_property#:~:text=Cf) (this may provide support for country flag emojis and bidirectional text)
whaledividers.advanced.snippetTextParser.description: What parser to use when creating whale divider titles (the text that sits between the control characters)
